content.question: An object is traveling across a flat horizontal surface with a constant velocity <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>v</mi></mstyle></math> when a net force of magnitude <math alttext="F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>F</mi></mstyle></math> is exerted on the object. In which of the following cases does the kinetic energy of the object remain constant?

choices.label: The force is exerted at less than <math alttext="90 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msup><mn>90</mn><mo>∘</mo></msup></mstyle></math> from the direction of the velocity.
The force is exerted in in the same direction as the velocity.
The force is exerted in the opposite direction as the velocity.
The force is exerted <math alttext="90 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msup><mn>90</mn><mo>∘</mo></msup></mstyle></math> from the direction of the velocity.

content.answer: The force is exerted <math alttext="90 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msup><mn>90</mn><mo>∘</mo></msup></mstyle></math> from the direction of the velocity.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
